definition: from beginning to end, (mathematics) expressed to the nearest integer, ten, hundred, or thousand, the usual activities in your day, become round, plump, or shapely
details:
adverb
- from beginning to end
= synonyms: around
adjective
- (mathematics) expressed to the nearest integer, ten, hundred, or thousand
= example: (mathematics) expressed to the nearest integer, ten, hundred, or thousand
- when a sound is full and rich
= example: when a sound is full and rich
= synonyms: rotund, orotund, pear-shaped
- having a circular shape
= synonyms: circular
noun
- the usual activities in your day
= example: the usual activities in your day
= synonyms: daily round
- the activity of playing 18 holes of golf
= example: the activity of playing 18 holes of golf
= synonyms: round of golf
- often plural; a series of professional calls, usually in a set order
= example: often plural; a series of professional calls, usually in a set order
- any circular or rotating mechanism
= synonyms: circle
- a charge of ammunition for a single shot
= synonyms: unit of ammunition, one shot
- a crosspiece between the legs of a chair
= synonyms: rung, stave
- an outburst of applause
= example: an outburst of applause
- a partsong in which voices follow each other
= synonyms: troll
- a cut of beef between the rump and the lower leg
- a serving to each of a group, which is usually alcoholic
= example: a serving to each of a group, which is usually alcoholic
= synonyms: round of drinks
- a regular route for a sentry or policeman
= synonyms: beat
- the course along which communications spread
= example: the course along which communications spread
- (sports) a division during which one team is on the offensive
= synonyms: turn
- an interval during which a recurring sequence of events occurs
= synonyms: rhythm
verb
- become round, plump, or shapely
= synonyms: flesh out, fill out
- make round
= example: make round
= synonyms: round out, round off
- express as a round number
= example: express as a round number
= synonyms: round out, round off, round down
- bring to a highly developed, finished, or refined state
= synonyms: polish, round off, polish up, brush up
- attack in speech or writing
= synonyms: snipe
- pronounce with rounded lips
= synonyms: labialize, labialise
- wind around
